_source.body:
Any instructions?
----- Forwarded by Steven J Kean/NA/Enron on 01/18/2001 05:34 PM -----

	Linda Robertson
	01/16/2001 04:54 PM
		 
		 To: Steven J Kean/NA/Enron@Enron
		 cc: Richard Shapiro/NA/Enron@Enron
		 Subject: Ken Lay as NASA Administrator

I received a call today from Rep. John Culberson about a nascent campaign 
underway to nominate Ken Lay as NASA Administrator.  Rep. Culberson has 
broached this idea with Eugene Cernan, who liked the idea .   The Congressman 
asked that we check to see if Ken is interested, as he would like to 
orchestrate a campaign on Ken's behalf.  I promised the Congressman to check 
as to Ken's interest.  Steve, should I snuff this out?  Give him 
encouragement?  I need to call the Congressman back very soon.  Thanks.

Any instructions?
----- Forwarded by Steven J Kean/NA/Enron on 01/18/2001 05:34 PM -----

	Linda Robertson
	01/16/2001 04:54 PM
		 
		 To: Steven J Kean/NA/Enron@Enron
		 cc: Richard Shapiro/NA/Enron@Enron
		 Subject: Ken Lay as NASA Administrator

I received a call today from Rep. John Culberson about a nascent campaign 
underway to nominate Ken Lay as NASA Administrator.  Rep. Culberson has 
broached this idea with Eugene Cernan, who liked the idea .   The Congressman 
asked that we check to see if Ken is interested, as he would like to 
orchestrate a campaign on Ken's behalf.  I promised the Congressman to check 
as to Ken's interest.  Steve, should I snuff this out?  Give him 
encouragement?  I need to call the Congressman back very soon.  Thanks.

Sorry, I think you should talk directly with Rosalee.



	Karen Owens@EES
	02/27/2001 01:05 PM
		
		 To: Steven J Kean/NA/Enron@Enron
		 cc: Maureen McVicker/NA/Enron@Enron
		 Subject: Re: Ken Lay, Good Guys Award


Steve, I was wondering if you have any information for me or should I speak 
with someone else?  Thanks, Karen



Karen Owens
02/16/2001 11:52 AM


To: Steven J Kean/NA/Enron@Enron
cc: Maureen McVicker/NA/Enron@Enron 
Subject: Re: Ken Lay, Good Guys Award  


Steve, 

Do you have any information for me regarding this? 

Karen



Karen Owens
02/12/2001 10:12 AM


To: Steven J Kean/NA/Enron@Enron
cc: Maureen McVicker/NA/Enron@Enron 
Subject: Ken Lay, Good Guys Award


Steve,

Lou's sister, Sue Yang, is a member of the National Women's Political 
Caucus.  This organization has an annual award called "Good Guys" award, 
honoring nationally known men who have supported women on women's issues.  
This year they would like to honor Ken Lay, if he is interested.  Sue does 
need to know if he supports the equal rights amendment and particularly the 
pro-choice amendment as her organization is a pro-choice organization.

Sue can be reached at 908-707-0022 if you would like to speak with her.

Please advise on the above.

Karen

headers.Subject: Re: Ken Lay, Good Guys Award

headers.Subject: Re: Ken Lay, Good Guys Award

_source.body:
Unfortunately, Ken Lay will not be able to attend the meeting of the Asia 
Society Annual Board Meeting in October 2000.  He has conflicts on the 
calendar.

Thanks.

Rosalee for Ken Lay

headers.Subject: Asia Society Annual Board Meeting in October 2000

_source.body:
----- Forwarded by Ricardo Charvel/NA/Enron on 02/21/2001 04:50 PM -----

	Ricardo Charvel
	02/21/2001 04:47 PM
		 
		 To: Richard Shapiro/NA/Enron
		 cc: 
		 Subject: Ken Lay in Cancun

Rick,

Ken Lay is going to be the Co-Chair of the Mexico Meeting of the World 
Economic Forum to be held in Cancun on Feb. 26 and 27.  Rob Bradley asked me 
to prepare information and some talking points.  I drafted a presentation 
which apparently Ken Lay liked when we met with him on Feb. 9th.  Rob worked 
on making the wording better and came up with a final version of the talking 
points.

Rob handed me the responsibility of assisting Ken Lay at Cancun and Rosalee 
suggested that I be there personally.  I will be flying out on Sunday at noon 
and returning to Mexico on Tuesday late at night.

I am attaching the agenda for the event, the power point presentation and the 
talking points in word.


Talking points                       Slides




Lay's Participation       Agenda


Rick, I could not thank you properly for your support since at the time of 
your call I was not alone.  Kikumi and I are very grateful for your support 
and kindness.

Thank you again,

Ricardo

Rob handed me the responsibility of assisting Ken Lay at Cancun and Rosalee

headers.Subject: Asia Society Annual Board Meeting in October 2000

_source.body:
Milly

This looks good especially if you get Harris.  What do they want me to be part of if anything.  I was assuming the Breakfast and the Lunch and hopefully the meeting with Harris. Can you let me know so I can set up my schedule. I would like to go see the Toronto office and also get some personal time in.  

Thanks 

John

 -----Original Message-----
From: 	Cappelletto, Nella  
Sent:	Friday, March 16, 2001 10:07 AM
To:	Lavorato, John
Cc:	Kimberly Hillis/HOU/ECT@ENRON
Subject:	Ken Lay Agenda - April 4th, 2001

MESSAGE FROM ROB:

Please see the attached.

Regards, Nella

"Jacob, Sasha" <SJacob@GPC.CA> on 03/15/2001 01:49:36 PM

cc:	 
Subject:	Ken Lay Agenda - April 4th, 2001

As requested by Aleck Dadson, please find attached a draft agenda for
Mr.Lay's visit to Toronto on April 4th.

Sincerely,

Sasha Jacob
GPC International
sjacob@gpc.ca

<Embedded Picture (Device Independent Bitmap)>

Dear Sir,

I understand that Enron has just terminated
negotiations with regard to leasing some 1.5 million
sq.ft. of space at Canary Wharf in London.

I would like you to consider the London Dome. This has
sufficient space for all your needs, would provide a
high profile location, and I can put together a
package which would be financially extremely
beneficial to Enron.

Please reply to me at samberkovits@yahoo.com

__________________________________________________
Do You Yahoo!?
Yahoo! Photos - 35mm Quality Prints, Now Get 15 Free!
http://photos.yahoo.com/

e-mail sent on 10/22/01 by Sharron

e-mail sent 10/31/01

headers.Subject:
CANCELED FYI - (time tentative) - ECN 50M Dining - North America
 Budget Mtg. w/K.Lay, G.Whalley, M.Frevert

_source.body:
Mr. Kenneth Lay,

I am the main shareholder of the european company called ECOSQUARE.  The
company is owned also by NOMURA, the bank of Japan, and by CISALPINA
GESTIONI, an italian equity fund.

I'm writing You about the facts of ENRON, today.   I'm interested in Your
activities about the trading of energy, raw materials and so on but also in
a strong partnership could take a new interest from institutional investors.
ECOSQUARE works as broker of wastes, by-products, secondary materials and
recyclables, all around the world. ECOSQUARE was founded in 2000 and we are
quickly developing a very good international business model with an
addressable market evaluated in many billions of US dollar.
Today I am in New York City and I would have the fly to return in Europe
tomorrow evening. If You consider interesting evaluate the partnership I
will meet You in NYC as soon as possible before Sunday when I have to go in
Italy for some meetings.

I am 32 old, I have studied nuclear engineering, I was been an assistant of
Professor Ilya Prigogine in Brussels, I am the founder and chief executive
of ECOSQUARE Co.  I am well known in Harvard University too.
From 2002 I will be in World Economic Forum as new member. You can find
other informations about me also by BLOOMBERG Terminals in "Who'sWho".
You can reach me in United States today by mobile +39-348-4767153.

Kind Regards,
Silvano Coletti, chief executive officer



ECOSQUARE SPA
Via Ferrini 2, 27100 PAVIA IT
Tel. +39-0382-413211
